quiz.title: Subject Pronouns - A1 Level
quiz.description: Master subject pronouns and person-pronoun agreement at A1 level.

questions.prompt: John is a student. ____ is 20 years old.
questions.explanation: Use 'He' to replace a male person's name.

questions.prompt: Mary is my sister. ____ is very kind.
questions.explanation: Use 'She' to replace a female person's name.

questions.prompt: The cat is sleeping. ____ is very tired.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for animals?

questions.prompt: My friends are coming. ____ are very excited.
questions.explanation: Use 'They' for plural people or things.

questions.prompt: My brother and I are students. ____ study English.
questions.explanation: Use 'We' when talking about yourself and others.

questions.prompt: ____ am a teacher.
____ are my best friend.
The book is on the table. ____ is very interesting.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for objects?

questions.prompt: Tom and Lisa are married. ____ live in London.
questions.explanation: Use 'They' for two or more people.
questions.hint: Tom and Lisa = how many people?

questions.prompt: My mother is a doctor. ____ works in a hospital.
My father is tall. ____ is 45 years old.
The dogs are playing. ____ are very happy.
My sister and you are friends. ____ like music.
questions.explanation: Use 'You' when talking about the person you're speaking to and others.

questions.prompt: The car is red. ____ is very fast.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for cars?

questions.prompt: My parents are kind. ____ help me a lot.
Anna and I are classmates. ____ sit together.
questions.explanation: Use 'We' when including yourself with others.

questions.prompt: The teacher is nice. ____ explains everything clearly.
questions.explanation: Use 'She' or 'He' depending on the teacher's gender. Here we assume female.

questions.prompt: My grandfather is old. ____ is 80 years old.
questions.explanation: Use 'He' for a male family member.

questions.prompt: The children are playing. ____ are in the garden.
The phone is ringing. ____ is very loud.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for phones?

questions.prompt: ____ and my friend study together.
Sarah is my cousin. ____ lives in Paris.
The birds are singing. ____ are very beautiful.
My uncle is funny. ____ tells good jokes.
questions.explanation: Use 'He' for a male family member.

questions.prompt: The house is big. ____ has five rooms.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for houses?

questions.prompt: You and I are team members. ____ work well together.
questions.explanation: Use 'We' when including yourself and the person you're talking to.

questions.prompt: The flowers are pretty. ____ smell nice too.
My aunt is a nurse. ____ works at night.
questions.explanation: Use 'She' for a female family member.

questions.prompt: The computer is new. ____ works very fast.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for computers?

questions.prompt: Peter and Mark are brothers. ____ look similar.
questions.explanation: Use 'They' for two or more people.
questions.hint: Peter and Mark = how many people?

questions.prompt: ____ are a good student.
My grandmother is wise. ____ gives good advice.
questions.explanation: Use 'She' for a female family member.

questions.prompt: The students are studying. ____ have an exam tomorrow.
The door is open. ____ needs to be closed.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for doors?

questions.prompt: My friends and I are going shopping. ____ need new clothes.
questions.explanation: Use 'We' when including yourself with others.
questions.hint: 'My friends and I' includes the speaker.

questions.prompt: Robert is my neighbor. ____ is very friendly.
The chairs are comfortable. ____ are made of wood.
____ like to read books.
questions.hint: Who is speaking about their preference?

questions.prompt: The window is dirty. ____ needs cleaning.
questions.explanation: Use 'It' for objects and parts of buildings.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for windows?

questions.prompt: Emma is my best friend. ____ understands me well.
The teachers are meeting. ____ are discussing the new curriculum.
My brother and sister are twins. ____ look exactly the same.
questions.explanation: Use 'They' for two or more people.
questions.hint: Brother and sister = how many people?

questions.prompt: The clock is broken. ____ doesn't work.
questions.hint: What pronoun do we use for clocks?

questions.prompt: ____ and your family are invited to the party.
questions.explanation: Use 'You' when talking to someone about them and their family.
